intro: Nectandra leucantha var. rodiei, commonly known as the white-flowered nectandra, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense canopy, making it an important component of the forest ecosystem. Its fruits are small, berry-like structures that contain seeds, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife. The tree is also valued for its timber and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
